s0304: In the tenth year, Duke Wu of Zhongshan first ascended the throne.
s0305: In the thirteenth year, they fortified Pingyi.
s0306: In the fifteenth year, Marquis Xian died, and his son Marquis Lie Ji ascended the throne.
s0307: In Marquis Lie's first year, Marquis Wen of Wei attacked Zhongshan and sent the crown prince to strike and defend it.
s0308: In the sixth year, Wei, Han, and Zhao all mutually recognized each other as feudal lords, and posthumously honored Xian Zi as Marquis Xian.
s0309: Marquis Lie loved music and asked his prime minister Gong Zhong Lian: 'I have a favorite - can I ennoble him?'
s0310: Gong Zhong said: 'You can enrich him, but ennobling him would not be good.'
s0312: The two singers from Zheng, Qiang and Shi - I will grant them fields of ten thousand mu each.'
s0314: But he did not give it to them.
s0315: After one month, Marquis Lie returned from Dai and asked about the singers' fields.
s0316: Gong Zhong said: 'I sought for them, but there were none suitable.'
s0317: Soon after, Marquis Lie asked again.
s0318: Gong Zhong still did not give them, and then feigned illness and did not attend court.
s0319: The lord of Fanwu came from Dai and said to Gong Zhong: 'You truly love goodness, but do not know what to hold to.
s0320: Now Gong Zhong has served as prime minister of Zhao for four years - have you advanced any worthy men?'
s0322: The lord of Fanwu said: 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, and Xu Yue are all suitable.'
s0323: Gong Zhong then advanced these three men.
s0324: When he attended court, Marquis Lie asked again: 'How are the singers' fields?'
s0325: Gong Zhong said: 'I am just now having the good ones selected.'
s0326: Niu Xu served Marquis Lie with benevolence and righteousness, advising with the way of the king. Marquis Lie was enlightened.
s0327: The next day, Xun Xin served with selecting and training the worthy, appointing officials based on ability.
s0328: The next day, Xu Yue served with economizing expenditures and carefully assessing merit and virtue.
s0329: All he gave was fully sufficient, and the lord was pleased.
s0330: Marquis Lie sent a messenger to tell the prime minister: 'The singers' fields will be stopped.'
s0331: He appointed Niu Xu as tutor, Xun Xin as commander of the guards, Xu Yue as minister of the interior, and granted the prime minister two sets of robes.
s0332: In the ninth year, Marquis Lie died, and his younger brother Duke Wu ascended the throne.
s0333: Duke Wu reigned thirteen years and died. Zhao again established Marquis Lie's crown prince Zhang, who became Marquis Jing.
s0334: This year, Marquis Wen of Wei died.
s0335: In Marquis Jing's first year, Duke Wu's son Chao rebelled but failed, fleeing to Wei.
s0336: Zhao first established its capital at Handan.
s0337: In the second year, Zhao defeated Qi at Lingqiu.
s0338: In the third year, Zhao aided Wei at Linqiu, greatly defeating the Qi forces.
s0339: In the fourth year, Wei defeated Zhao at Tu Tai.
s0340: Zhao built Gangping to invade Wei.
s0341: In the fifth year, Qi and Wei attacked Zhao on behalf of Wei, taking Gangping.
s0342: In the sixth year, Zhao borrowed troops from Chu to attack Wei, taking Ji Pu.
s0343: In the eighth year, Zhao captured Wei's Huang City.
s0344: In the ninth year, Zhao attacked Qi.
s0345: Qi attacked Yan, and Zhao aided Yan.
s0346: In the tenth year, Zhao fought with Zhongshan at Fangzi.
s0347: In the eleventh year, Wei, Han, and Zhao together destroyed Jin and divided its territory.
s0348: Zhao attacked Zhongshan again and fought at Zhongren.
s0349: In the twelfth year, Marquis Jing died, and his son Marquis Cheng Zhong ascended the throne.
s0350: In Marquis Cheng's first year, Prince Sheng contended with Marquis Cheng for the throne and rebelled.
s0351: In the second year, sixth month, it snowed.
s0352: In the third year, Tai Wu Wu served as prime minister.
s0353: Zhao attacked Wei and took seventy-three towns and villages.
